intro: Harpalyce baracoensis, commonly known as the Baracoensian harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pod-like fruits and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects.
